taxonomicnotes: Devario malabaricus was described by Jerdon (1849) from Malabar as Perilampus malabaricus. No types are however known. Devario malabaricus is most likely a species complex. There also exist considerable taxonomic ambiguities between D. malabaricus and D. aequipinnatus (see  Shaji and Easa 2003 and references therein).
rationale: Devario malabaricus has been assessed as Least Concern due to its wide distribution, abundance and its ability to occupy a range of habitats.  As there are potential threats to the species in part of its range, continuous research and monitoring of population trends and direct threats are recommended.
evaluator: Ali, A., Dahanukar, N. & Molur, S.
